H0.text: Chromosphere is the region of the sun on which sunspots—dark spots that are cooler than the surrounding area—occur.

H1.text: The core is the region of the sun where sunspots, appearing as dark spots cooler than the surrounding area, occur.

H2.text: Corona is the region of the sun where sunspots, appearing as dark spots that are cooler than their surroundings, occur.

H3.text: Photosphere is the region of the sun where sunspots appear as dark spots cooler than the surrounding area.

A4.text: Other magnetically related phenomena in the Sun's photosphere include sunspots and solar faculae dispersed between granules.
